title: AROUND THE NATION;Homosexual Is Denied Citizenship in U.S.
body:
A three-judge Federal appeals panel has ruled, 2 to 1, that homosexual aliens should not be allowed entry into the 
United States and therefore cannot become citizens.

Richard John Longstaff, a British national who lives in Dallas, was a homosexual when he came to the United 
States in 1965, making his entry illegal, the United States Court of Appeals for the Fifth Circuit ruled Wednesday.
Federal court, New Orleans, rules homosexual aliens may not become US citizens, Richard John Longstaff 
application (S)The ruling upheld that of the Federal Northern District Court in Texas.

The appeals court, in a 31-page opinion, said it interpreted the Immigration and Nationality Act of 1952 to mean 
homosexuals should be denied entry into country. Legal entry is required for naturalization, which Mr. Longstaff 
was seeking.

The three-judge panel did not rule on whether Mr. Longstaff should be deported.

Mr. Longstaff, 43 years old, who owns two clothing and hairdressing shops in Dallas, argued that he had entered 
the country legally since no medical determination of his homosexuality was made at the time he received his visa.
